search.js

Implementation for the search functionality of Firefox Panorama.

Summary
search.jsImplementation for the search functionality of Firefox Panorama.
Functions
scorePatternMatchGiven a pattern string, returns a score between 0 and 1 of how well that pattern matches the original string.
TabUtilsA collection of helper functions for dealing with both TabItems and <xul:tab>s without having to worry which one is which.
Functions
_nameOfTabGiven a TabItem or a <xul:tab> returns the tab’s name.
favURLOfGiven a TabItem or a <xul:tab> returns the URL of tab’s favicon.
focusGiven a TabItem or a <xul:tab>, focuses it and it’s window.
TabMatcherA singleton class that allows you to iterate over matching and not-matching tabs, given a case-insensitive search term.
Functions
_filterAndSortMatchesGiven an array of TabItems and <xul:tab>s returns a new array of tabs whose name matched the search term, sorted by lexical closeness.
_filterForUnmatchesGiven an array of TabItems returns an unsorted array of tabs whose name does not match the the search term.
_getTabsForOtherWindowsReturns an array of TabItems and <xul:tabs>s representing that tabs from all windows but the currently focused window.
matchedTabsFromOtherWindowsReturns an array of TabItems and <xul:tab>s that match the search term from all windows but the currently focused window.
matchedReturns an array of TabItems which match the current search term.
unmatchedReturns all of TabItems that .matched() doesn’t return.
doSearchPerforms the search.
SearchEventHandlerClassA singleton class that handles all of the event handlers.
Functions
initInitializes the searchbox to be focused, and everything else to be hidden, and to have everything have the appropriate event handlers;
beforeSearchKeyHandlerHandles all keypresses before the search interface is brought up.
inSearchKeyHandlerHandles all keypresses while search mode.
switchToBeforeModeMake sure the event handlers are appropriate for the before-search mode.
switchToInModeMake sure the event handlers are appropriate for the in-search mode.

Functions

scorePatternMatch

function scorePatternMatch(pattern,
matched,
offset)

Given a pattern string, returns a score between 0 and 1 of how well that pattern matches the original string.  It mimics the heuristics of the Mac application launcher Quicksilver.

TabUtils

A collection of helper functions for dealing with both TabItems and <xul:tab>s without having to worry which one is which.

Summary
Functions
_nameOfTabGiven a TabItem or a <xul:tab> returns the tab’s name.
favURLOfGiven a TabItem or a <xul:tab> returns the URL of tab’s favicon.
focusGiven a TabItem or a <xul:tab>, focuses it and it’s window.

nameOf: function TabUtils_nameOfTab(tab)

Given a TabItem or a <xul:tab> returns the tab’s name.

favURLOf

Given a TabItem or a <xul:tab> returns the URL of tab’s favicon.

focus

focus: function TabUtils_focus(tab)

Given a TabItem or a <xul:tab>, focuses it and it’s window.

TabMatcher

A singleton class that allows you to iterate over matching and not-matching tabs, given a case-insensitive search term.

Summary
Functions
_filterAndSortMatchesGiven an array of TabItems and <xul:tab>s returns a new array of tabs whose name matched the search term, sorted by lexical closeness.
_filterForUnmatchesGiven an array of TabItems returns an unsorted array of tabs whose name does not match the the search term.
_getTabsForOtherWindowsReturns an array of TabItems and <xul:tabs>s representing that tabs from all windows but the currently focused window.
matchedTabsFromOtherWindowsReturns an array of TabItems and <xul:tab>s that match the search term from all windows but the currently focused window.
matchedReturns an array of TabItems which match the current search term.
unmatchedReturns all of TabItems that .matched() doesn’t return.
doSearchPerforms the search.

Functions

_filterAndSortMatches

Given an array of TabItems and <xul:tab>s returns a new array of tabs whose name matched the search term, sorted by lexical closeness.

_filterForUnmatches

_filterForUnmatches: function TabMatcher__filterForUnmatches(tabs)

Given an array of TabItems returns an unsorted array of tabs whose name does not match the the search term.

_getTabsForOtherWindows

_getTabsForOtherWindows: function TabMatcher__getTabsForOtherWindows()

Returns an array of TabItems and <xul:tabs>s representing that tabs from all windows but the currently focused window.  TabItems will be returned for windows in which Panorama has been activated at least once, while <xul:tab>s will be return for windows in which Panorama has never been activated.

matchedTabsFromOtherWindows

matchedTabsFromOtherWindows: function TabMatcher_matchedTabsFromOtherWindows()

Returns an array of TabItems and <xul:tab>s that match the search term from all windows but the currently focused window.  TabItems will be returned for windows in which Panorama has been activated at least once, while <xul:tab>s will be return for windows in which Panorama has never been activated.  (new TabMatcher(“app”)).matchedTabsFromOtherWindows();

matched

matched: function TabMatcher_matched()

Returns an array of TabItems which match the current search term.  If the term is less than 2 characters in length, it returns nothing.

unmatched

unmatched: function TabMatcher_unmatched()

Returns all of TabItems that .matched() doesn’t return.

doSearch

doSearch: function TabMatcher_doSearch(matchFunc,
unmatchFunc,
otherFunc)

Performs the search.  Lets you provide three functions.  The first is on all matched tabs in the window, the second on all unmatched tabs in the window, and the third on all matched tabs in other windows.  The first two functions take two parameters: A TabItem and its integer index indicating the absolute rank of the TabItem in terms of match to the search term.  The last function also takes two paramaters, but can be passed both TabItems and <xul:tab>s and the index is offset by the number of matched tabs inside the window.

SearchEventHandlerClass

A singleton class that handles all of the event handlers.

Summary
Functions
